function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Exclusion of sensors for chemical pollutants and noise levels may lead to undetected exposure to harmful substances and inadequate assessment of acoustic impacts on ieq.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessing room acoustic performance in an unoccupied room with hvac running and closed windows may not accurately reflect real-life conditions for disease propagation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of immediate control means or technologies for acoustic environment in most buildings.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of noise levels may be less valuable in comparison with other indoor environmental quality ieq parameters.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to visualize real-time ieq data due to display module malfunction.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interference from heat dissipation affecting accuracy of air temperature and humidity sensors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate data transmission and storage architecture","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate software design for data presentation and human-computer interaction","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of multi-source data access increases the risk of spreading contagious diseases if proper hygiene and safety measures are not in place.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mobile interface and qr code scanning for building occupants may pose a risk of viral transmission if hygiene practices are not followed.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Real-time ieq data assessment through the mobile interface creates an environment for potential virus exposure among the occupants if proper sanitization measures are not in place.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement results not within the compliance range","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lowered weight of illuminance","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to measure noise level","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weighting scheme subject to revision","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited historical ieq data query on mobile interface less than one day","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Subjective bias in ieq voting module","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Passive acceptance of ratings leading to biased feedback","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of dry ice and incense to create high co2 and pm2.5 concentrations","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of variable refrigerant volume air conditioning system and humidifier for thermal environment control","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate co2 concentration and illuminance measurement due to lack of long-term baseline determination","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unreliable temperature, rh, and pm 2.5 concentration measurements due to fluctuating outdoor weather and other factors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misleading data due to inaccurate baseline measurements and lack of self-calibration validity under certain conditions","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupancy density leading to increased risk of disease spread and infection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient cleaning and sanitation leading to microbial contamination and disease transmission through fomites objects or surfaces .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imbalance between supply and demand in thermal environment control","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overheating in the cold zone during winter","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient heating in the hscw zone during winter","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of indoor thermal performance throughout the year may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases within the building.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the hospital building may lead to high co2 concentrations, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated pm 2.5 concentrations in the hospital building may indicate poor indoor air quality, posing health risks to occupants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Thermal discomfort in the offices may lead to reduced productivity and occupant dissatisfaction.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high co2 concentrations in inpatient wards","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlations between subjective and objective ieq data","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Indoor air and co2 concentration affect occupant satisfaction.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in climate and hvac systems between northern and southern china affect thermal experiences and preferences.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak acceptance of cooler conditions in the northern group","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overcooling problem in buildings in northern china","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Narrow range of adaptation to thermal environment in winter for occupants in northern china","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in air quality satisfaction due to ventilation types in buildings in china","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupants may consider air quality unacceptable regardless of objective performance, leading to dissatisfaction and potential health risks.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lower acceptance for high co2 concentrations in building type a compared to building type b, leading to potential dissatisfaction and discomfort for occupants.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited sensor diversity in ibem may lead to incomplete monitoring of ieq parameters and potential health risks.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sensor customization and flexibility in ibem limits its adaptability to different ieq monitoring scenarios.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data flow and feedback interaction in ibem may hinder real-time adjustment of environmental parameters based on occupants' needs and preferences.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scientific and simplified deployment scheme for ibem","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Automatic linkage of ibem with environmental control system","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of the ibem hardware instrument with contagious pathogens or microbes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate data security for the extensive ieq database","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"}]}
